nodes.bodyText:
can be replaced by
Subscribes a user to {@value org.nuxeo.ecm.platform.comment.api.CommentEvents#COMMENT_ADDED} event on the document
we subscribe to an event

The subscription works with the notification, not the event. They are not equal:
the notification is "CommentAdded"
the event is "commentAdded"
The first will work (it has no constant outside the one defined here: COMMENT_ADDED_NOTIFICATION), the second not.
so I changed for

/**
* Subscribes a user to {@value #COMMENT_ADDED_NOTIFICATION} notifications on the document.
*
* @param document the document being commented
* @param user the user to subscribe to comment notifications
* @SInCE 11.1
*/
Extra feedbacks are welcome

i think we should rework the javadoc to be more readable like Subscribes the comment author on events to the top level document. for more context on for example which event are added during this subscription you can use
@implspec and sure we can ask the team for more feedbacks ...:)

org.nuxeo.ecm.platform.ec.notification.service.NotificationService#addSubscriptions((String username, DocumentModel doc, Boolean sendConfirmationEmail, NuxeoPrincipal principal))
through the Subscription operation. we don't give the name of the notification and then the method that will be called is doc.getAdapter(SubscriptionAdapter.class).addSubscriptionsToAll(username); which will add the notification list below:
"Modification", "CommentPublication", "Approbation review started", "CommentUpdated", "Creation", "CommentAdded", "Workflow Change"
my interrogations:

do we need to send a mail to notify that the user is now auto-subscribed: .addSubscription(subscriber, COMMENT_ADDED_NOTIFICATION, document, false, user, COMMENT_ADDED_NOTIFICATION);
false means no mail will be sent when we subscribe

I would go for StringUtils.isBlank here.
